snippet: The agency’s decision makes it unlikely that developers of the huge open-pit project in the Bristol Bay watershed will be able to proceed.
abstract: Environmental Protection Agency, citing risks to water quality and salmon spawning grounds, moves to block the development of a giant open-pit copper mine in the watershed of Bristol Bay in southwest Alaska; decision is not outright death blow but leaves little room for the mine and its supporters to persuade the EPA otherwise.
lead_paragraph: The agency’s decision makes it unlikely that developers of the huge open-pit project in the Bristol Bay watershed will be able to proceed.

headline.main: E.P.A. Says It Will Fight Mine Project in Alaska
headline.print_headline: E.P.A. Says It Will Fight Mine Project in Alaska
